name: misposition
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to put something or someone in the wrong position or place: The icon appears to be mispositioned. It is possible to mis-position the patient. Related word
position verb
More examplesFewer examplesElectric sockets and fittings were inconvenient, dangerous, or mispositioned.The faults listed in the report included roof straps and hangers being bent, mispositioned, or inadequate. Across the data, questions that were mispositioned attracted the same type of response.It was also noted that cells that were mis-positioned were able to undergo a change of position.
